Package edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.parser

The Parser package defines an abstract parser used by the transformational interpreter, and a generic end-of-statement detector.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IParser
    Interface that parsers, preprocessors, and statement detectors must satisfy.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractParser
    AbstractParser encapsulates common features of parsers including buffering input lines to parse and caching literals.
    ParserFromGrammar
    Outer parser wrapper for generated parser.
    ParserFromPreprocessor
    Outer parser wrapper for a line parser such as a preprocessor or statement detector.
    StatementDetector
    StatementDetector identifies parsible units in the source input to pass to specific target sub-interpreters for parsing and execution.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ParseException
    ParseException contains errors or warnings from parsing the source language or target substrate languages.

Package edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.parser Description

The Parser package defines an abstract parser used by the transformational interpreter, and a generic end-of-statement detector. This abstract parser is used to implement a chain of preprocessors and parsers for the interactive interpreter.

Input statements are first piped through a preprocessor which handles directives and syntax touchup, then through a metaparser for end-of-statement detection, then into the parser which generates an XML Abstract Syntax Tree (XML-AST). The parsed statements are then transformed using XSLT and run on the substrate interpreter.

Parsers for a specific language are built using dependency injection in the Spring configuration file: the outer metaparser layer is injected with a technology-specific layer, such as for grammars/javacc, which in turn is injected with a language-specific generated parser such as for Junicon.
